intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. hemicaesium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often reddish in color. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed due to its aggressive growth habit.
